title: Why did Azir and Kalista fall under Riot Games shitlist?
body:
Serious question this time around for what it is worth, lol.

I play League of Legends under a relatively tame impression Riot Games has an agenda based entirely on money and E-Sports. I am aware of what champions are deemed acceptable to them and what aren't: The acceptable ones are the champions with allegedly high skill caps, flashy plays, and general flexibility. What I believe is unacceptable to them are simplistic champions or ones with playstyles that are border far too off the norm (i.e {{champion:74}} )

So to this day, I am still bewildered by their obvious and admitted negligence of Azir and Kalista. Both champions **perfectly** fit Riot Games agenda with the hype and cash they generated with E-Sports, their general dominance, and absurd flexibility to do anything and everything for their respective roles at their peak.

They've both since been gutted and abandoned for the time being. Why I care about this is because it agitates me to assume what I think of Riot and their balancing philosophy might not be true, which I adamantly refuse to believe.

That makes absolutely no fucking sense when Lee Sin is allowed as he is and hasn't incurred Riot's wrath, ever. Among other reasons why I am confused as to just **what** their champion agenda really is.

If you look at stats, though, Lee is not out of line. He's very popular, and I think there are VERY frustrating things about his kit (that's important and I don't want to minimize that), but he's not OP. 

Azir and Kalista didn't just FEEL unfair, they WERE unfair. When played perfectly, there was almost nothing you could do to counter them. The counterplay was "wait for the person playing them to mess up, then make sure you can take advantage of that."

I started seeing Kalista just last patch again because of how strong Bork was. My experience was very similar to the horror I used to experience with her; as soon as she gets ahead, you are just screwed for the rest of the game. 

I don't agree that Lee Sin has that problem, and in my opinion, the stats support that. Is he annoying? Yes. Are there ways to improve his kit that would be healthy for the game? Absolutely. Is he OP? Nope.

Idk about Lee. Maybe he's just easier to balance with Riot. Maybe it's because he actually does fall off and can't carry on his own in pro play. 

Idk, but I don't think that justifies keeping Azir or Kalista out of the garbage.

Kalista IS NOT GARBAGE

wtf is wrong with you people? 50% win rate champ is garbage now?

I... actually agree. I think people would permit Lee every day rather than be reminded _why_ Azir and Kalista are in the dumpster. They're suffocating picks when they're allowed to be strong.

azir and kalista/ banned after their strengths were shown in proplay and if they were left at their current state the champions would be too strong.

We have "Too much water" for ROSA.
We've got "Too much power" for Kalista and Azir. They were jack of all trades on steroids. That's why they're on the shitlist.

They lacked counterplay. They are both hypercarries with insane selfpeel/kite potential, that completly denies any attempt to get close to them and kill them. For the fun of the game its better that both of them are gutted. (And I'm a former azir main)

Azir had so many different strengths and such wide utility that he made other mage picks irrelevant. Similarly, Kalista'w passive made facing her as a melee champ an exercise in futility, as well as letting her avoid skillshots with laughable ease, while her stacking spears gave her team a second smite, and her ult have hard engage to champions who ought to lack such a thing.

In short, they were too good.

I main ADC and I've picked up Kalista about a month ago. I actually think she's in a good spot right now but most people don't know how to play her. And when you think about it Challenger players can play most champions at their strongest, and Azir is still good but you have to be good at him. I've seen some Azirs that clearly main him but others who just play him every so often. Even though I do think Azir needs a bit of a buff.Same with Kalista. The reason they're changing Heimer is because he was really oppressive to a lot of top laners and could just sit there and shove. I mean if you've watched E-sports when Kalista and Azir were picked a lot it's because they were really strong in the hands of people who knew how to use them to their fullest.
